column2: WISCONSIN PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You must come to a full stop at a yield sign:
column6: Before you decrease speed and reach the intersection.
column8: Never.

column2: 2. When changing lanes, you should not:
column4: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.
column6: use the inside rearview mirror to check for blind spots
column8: check your side and rear view mirrors.

column2: 3. This traffic sign warns you about:
column6: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.
column8: a winding road.

column2: 4. Roads are most slippery:
column6: when it first starts to rain.
column8: just before it rains.

column2: 5. When driving in heavy traffic, you should:
column4: drive faster than the flow of traffic.
column6: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column8: maintain a constant speed.
column10: drive with the flow of traffic.

column2: 6. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column6: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.
column8: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column10: Take your foot off the gas and shift to neutral.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column8: No right turn

column2: 8. The sign in the picture:
column6: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column8: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column10: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 9. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be prepared to stop before the intersection.
column8: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column10: speed up to beat the red light.

column2: 10. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column6: go back and wait the “WALK” light
column8: finish crossing the street.

column2: 11. Always driving slower than other traffic:
column6: is a good defensive driving technique.
column8: is always safer than driving faster than other traffic.

column2: 12. The first thing affected after drinking alcohol is:
column8: speech.

column2: 13. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 14. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column4: number of cars in front of you.
column8: presence of a yield sign.
column10: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.

column2: 15. What do flashing red lights on a school bus indicate?
column4: The bus is about to stop.
column6: You must pass the school bus.
column8: Traffic that approaches from either direction may proceed.
column10: The bus is stopped to load or discharge passengers.

column2: 16. This sign means:
column8: There is a traffic signal ahead

column2: 17. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column10: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 18. To drive defensively, you must:
column8: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column10: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 19. Drivers under the age of 21 are subject to a specific restriction prohibiting them from driving:
column8: before midnight.

column2: 20. Drivers may continue carefully through a yellow light if:
column6: they already are within the intersection.
column8: an emergency vehicle is crossing your lane.

column2: 21. This sign indicates:
column8: A slow-moving vehicle

column2: 22. This sign means:
column8: Wrong way; Turn around immediately.

column2: 23. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column8: parking lights.

column2: 24. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: Slower vehicles must keep left.
column10: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 25. If one of your tires blows out while driving, you should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly and steer toward the right edge of the road.
column6: hold the steering wheel tightly and shift into neutral to bring the front of the vehicle back in line.
column8: pump the brakes.
column10: hold the steering wheel firmly, slow down, and steer smoothly.

column2: 26. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column6: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column8: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
column10: can turn left. You have the right of way.

column2: 27. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: Drive with caution.
column10: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 28. Which shape is a yield sign?
column8: Vertical rectangle

column2: 29. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column8: Diamond

column2: 30. You are stopped at a stop sign and you are going to go straight through the intersection. A car on the cross road has stopped at a stop sign on your right and is going to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: You.

column2: 31. Worn tires:
column8: may cause you to hydroplane even with very little water on the road.

column2: 32. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column8: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.

column2: 33. This sign means:
column8: Reversible lane ahead.
column10: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 34. You may drive faster than the posted speed limit:
column8: when passing another vehicle, as long as it is safe to do so.

column2: 35. When preparing to exit an expressway, drivers should start reducing their speed:
column4: immediately upon entering the deceleration lane.
column6: about halfway through the deceleration lane.
column8: at least 100 feet before entering the deceleration lane.

column2: 36. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column8: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.
column10: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.

column2: 37. This road sign means:
column8: Stop sign ahead

column2: 38. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.

column2: 39. You should never depend on your mirrors when you prepare to change lanes. Why?
column8: Mirrors leave “blind spots” behind both sides of vehicles.
column10: You should look over your shoulder instead.

column2: 40. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 41. The blind spot  to the rear of large trucks can extend for:
column8: 150 feet

column2: 42. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column8: high beam lights.

column2: 43. This road sign means:
column6: When pavement is wet, reduce your speed
column8: Watch for vehicles entering from the side

column2: 44. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.
column6: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column8: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.

column2: 45. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column8: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column10: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 46. There are two traffic lanes in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right, and the driver behind you wishes to drive faster. You should:
column4: move over into the right lane when safe to do so.
column6: stay in your lane and maintain your current speed.
column8: drive onto the left shoulder to let the other driver pass.

column2: 47. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column8: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 48. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: remove the sign and move forward.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column8: look for a detour or another route.

column2: 49. This road sign means:
column8: Cars in right lane must slow down
column10: Pass only in the right lane

column2: 50. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column8: narrower and shorter
